verses.verse: Open<WH6605> thy doors<WH1817>, O Lebanon<WH3844>, that the fire<WH784> may devour<WH398> thy cedars<WH730>.

Howl<WH3213>, fir tree<WH1265>; for the cedar<WH730> is fallen<WH5307>; because the mighty<WH117> are spoiled<WH7703>: howl<WH3213>, O ye oaks<WH437> of Bashan<WH1316>; for the forest<WH3293> of the vintage<WH1208><WH1219> is come down<WH3381>.

¶ There is a voice<WH6963> of the howling<WH3215> of the shepherds<WH7462>; for their glory<WH155> is spoiled<WH7703>: a voice<WH6963> of the roaring<WH7581> of young lions<WH3715>; for the pride<WH1347> of Jordan<WH3383> is spoiled<WH7703>.
Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> my God<WH430>; Feed<WH7462> the flock<WH6629> of the slaughter<WH2028>;

Whose possessors<WH7069> slay<WH2026> them, and hold themselves not guilty<WH816>: and they that sell<WH4376> them say<WH559>, Blessed<WH1288> be the LORD<WH3068>; for I am rich<WH6238>: and their own shepherds<WH7462> pity<WH2550> them not.

For I will no more pity<WH2550> the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>: but, lo, I will deliver<WH4672> the men<WH120> every one<WH376> into his neighbour's<WH7453> hand<WH3027>, and into the hand<WH3027> of his king<WH4428>: and they shall smite<WH3807> the land<WH776>, and out of their hand<WH3027> I will not deliver<WH5337> them.

And I will feed<WH7462> the flock<WH6629> of slaughter<WH2028>, even you<WH3651>, O poor<WH6041> of the flock<WH6629>. And I took<WH3947> unto me two<WH8147> staves<WH4731>; the one<WH259> I called<WH7121> Beauty<WH5278>, and the other<WH259> I called<WH7121> Bands<WH2254>; and I fed<WH7462> the flock<WH6629>.
Three<WH7969> shepherds<WH7462> also I cut off<WH3582> in one<WH259> month<WH3391>; and my soul<WH5315> lothed<WH7114> them, and their soul<WH5315> also abhorred<WH973> me.

Then said<WH559> I, I will not feed<WH7462> you: that that dieth<WH4191>, let it die<WH4191>; and that that is to be cut off<WH3582>, let it be cut off<WH3582>; and let the rest<WH7604> eat<WH398> every one<WH802> the flesh<WH1320> of another<WH7468>.
¶ And I took<WH3947> my staff<WH4731>, even Beauty<WH5278>, and cut it asunder<WH1438>, that I might break<WH6565> my covenant<WH1285> which I had made<WH3772> with all the people<WH5971>.
And it was broken<WH6565> in that day<WH3117>: and so the poor<WH6041> of the flock<WH6629> that waited<WH8104> upon me knew<WH3045> that it was the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068>.

And I said<WH559> unto them, If ye think<WH5869> good<WH2896>, give<WH3051> me my price<WH7939>; and if not, forbear<WH2308>. So they weighed<WH8254> for my price<WH7939> thirty<WH7970> pieces of silver<WH3701>.

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto me, Cast<WH7993> it unto the potter<WH3335>: a goodly<WH145> price<WH3366> that I was prised at<WH3365> of them. And I took<WH3947> the thirty<WH7970> pieces of silver<WH3701>, and cast<WH7993> them to the potter<WH3335> in the house<WH1004> of the LORD<WH3068>.
Then I cut asunder<WH1438> mine other<WH8145> staff<WH4731>, even Bands<WH2254>, that I might break<WH6565> the brotherhood<WH264> between Judah<WH3063> and Israel<WH3478>.
¶ And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto me, Take<WH3947> unto thee yet the instruments<WH3627> of a foolish<WH196> shepherd<WH7462>.

For, lo, I will raise up<WH6965> a shepherd<WH7462> in the land<WH776>, which shall not visit<WH6485> those that be cut off<WH3582>, neither shall seek<WH1245> the young one<WH5289>, nor heal<WH7495> that that is broken<WH7665>, nor feed<WH3557> that that standeth<WH5324> still: but he shall eat<WH398> the flesh<WH1320> of the fat<WH1277>, and tear<WH6561> their claws<WH6541> in pieces<WH6561>.

Woe<WH1945> to the idol<WH457> shepherd<WH7473> that leaveth<WH5800> the flock<WH6629>! the sword<WH2719> shall be upon his arm<WH2220>, and upon his right<WH3225> eye<WH5869>: his arm<WH2220> shall be clean<WH3001> dried up<WH3001>, and his right<WH3225> eye<WH5869> shall be utterly<WH3543> darkened<WH3543>.
